page.title: 15QUEEN ELIZABETH COTTAGE.
page.content: {Queen Elizabeth cottage}was built in the time of{Elizabeth the 1st.}It is about{400 years}old.It is built on {sarson stone}.The beams are mostly{oak with some{elm}and one or two large timbers from ships.The chimney is built in the middle of the house to keep it all warm it is made from {chalkstone}and brick.The older part of the attic walls are made of{wattle and{daub.Daub}is mud' horsehair and cow dung{.Wattle}is hazel sticks intertwined like a fence.There is one {flagstone}floor remaining.Some of the original windows remain.They are made of lead.Most of them are in the barn.The house is a listed building of special{Achitectural}and{historical interest.If you come down{BroadTown {hill Queen Elizabeth cottage}is on the right just before the{church.
